dt: {bc}to come into the presence of for the first time {bc}to be introduced to or become acquainted with

dt.t: I'm pleased to {wi}meet{/wi} you.
Where did you two {wi}meet{/wi} each other?
I {wi}met{/wi} him in college.
We {wi}met{/wi} her through a mutual friend.

dt: {bc}to come together with especially at a particular time or place

dt.t: I'll {wi}meet{/wi} you at the station

dt: {bc}to come into contact or conjunction with {bc}{sx|join||}

dt.t: There is where the brook {wi}meets{/wi} the river.
a pungent odor … {it}met{/it} his nostrils
{it}met{/it} the heavyweight in a successful bout

dt: {bc}to enter into conference, argument, or personal dealings with

dt.t: We {wi}met{/wi} her over coffee.

dt: {bc}to conform to especially with exactitude and precision

dt.t: a concept to {wi}meet{/wi} all requirements
could not {wi}meet{/wi} his loans
was able to {wi}meet{/wi} every social situation
enough money to {wi}meet{/wi} our needs
I want you to {wi}meet{/wi} my sister.
The proposal has {wi}met{/wi} some opposition.
You will likely {wi}meet{/wi} many obstacles on your journey.
He {wi}met{/wi} an untimely death.

dt: {bc}to receive or greet in an official capacity

dt.t: The president {it}met{/it} the prime minister at the White House.
That's the restaurant where they {it}met{/it}.

dt: {bc}to come together for a common purpose {bc}{sx|assemble||}

dt.t: The delegates {it}met{/it} at the convention.

dt: {bc}to come together as contestants, opponents, or enemies

dt.t: The candidates {it}met{/it} for their debate.
the lines {wi}meet{/wi} in a point
many graces and many virtues {wi}meet{/wi} in her
The senators {wi}met halfway{/wi} on an energy bill.
We can't give you everything you've requested, but we can {wi}meet{/wi} you {wi}halfway{/wi}.
Can you {wi}meet{/wi} us {wi}halfway{/wi} on this? = Can we {wi}meet halfway{/wi} on this?
the proposal {it}met with{/it} opposition

et: Middle English {it}meten{/it}, from Old English {it}mētan{/it}; akin to Old English ge{it}mōt{/it} assembly {ma}{mat|moot:3|}{/ma}
shortdef: to come into the presence of for the first time : to be introduced to or become acquainted with
to come together with especially at a particular time or place
to come into contact or conjunction with : join

dt: {bc}a large gathering of athletes for a sports competition

dt.t: a wrestling/gymnastic {wi}meet{/wi}
the championship {wi}meet{/wi}

… everyone has a personal laundry list of what generally ails track and field. Some say the failure to have more {wi}meets{/wi} on television heads the list. But merely putting a {wi}meet{/wi} on television won't solve the sport's failure to promote itself.

dt: {bc}a gathering of mounted hunters and their hunting dogs for hunting

dt.t: When hunting with hounds was legal, I used to attend the Boxing Day {wi}meet{/wi} in Newbury Market Place, hoping that the hunt members would have a jolly good day out but that the fox would get away.

It was so cold that I nursed a hope that a glass of cherry brandy … might be on offer at the {wi}meet{/wi}. But no, we gathered at a gate leading to open country and the hills near which most of the foxhunters … mounted.

dt: {bc}an instance of coming together at a particular time or place especially for the first time

dt.t: They set up a {wi}meet{/wi} with a potential buyer.
So I confess to being a bit skeptical about meeting someone online, texting back and forth, finally arranging a {wi}meet{/wi}, and having it develop into a committed lifelong relationship.

shortdef: a large gathering of athletes for a sports competition
a gathering of mounted hunters and their hunting dogs for hunting
an instance of coming together at a particular time or place especially for the first time

dt: {bc}precisely adapted to a particular situation, need, or circumstance {bc}very proper

dt.t: … their ghosts … haunt the fires by which sit armed men, as is {wi}meet{/wi} for the spirits of fearless warriors who died in battle.

pt: {sc}fit{/sc} {sc}suitable{/sc} {sc}meet{/sc} {sc}proper{/sc} {sc}appropriate{/sc} {sc}fitting{/sc} {sc}apt{/sc} {sc}happy{/sc}{sc}felicitous{/sc} mean right with respect to some end, need, use, or circumstance. {sc}fit{/sc} stresses adaptability and sometimes special readiness for use or action.
{sc}suitable{/sc} implies an answering to requirements or demands.
{sc}proper{/sc} suggests a suitability through essential nature or accordance with custom.
{sc}fitting{/sc} implies harmony of mood or tone.
{sc}apt{/sc} connotes a fitness marked by nicety and discrimination.
{sc}happy{/sc} suggests what is effectively or successfully appropriate.
{sc}felicitous{/sc} suggests an aptness that is opportune, telling, or graceful.

et: Middle English {it}mete{/it}, from Old English {it}gemǣte{/it}; akin to Old English {it}metan{/it} to mete
shortdef: precisely adapted to a particular situation, need, or circumstance : very proper

cxs.cxl: past tense and past participle of

dt: {bc}a reception at which a public figure (such as a politician or rock star) socializes with press members and other guests

dt.t: The candidate held a {it}meet and greet{/it} with voters.
The pop singer took time for a {it}meet and greet{/it} with fans.

shortdef: a reception at which a public figure (such as a politician or rock star) socializes with press members and other guests

dt: {bc}a cute, charming, or amusing first encounter between romantic partners (as in a movie)

dt.t: It's a {wi}meet-cute{/wi} where they fall immediately in love: her because he's handsome; him because she forgets a pen to write with.
Rom-com tropes like the "{wi}meet-cute{/wi}" are so tired that you can't just spoof them—you have to spoof the spoofs …
… upper-middlebrow "{wi}meet cutes{/wi}" such as in Nora Ephron's popular {it}You've Got Mail{/it} …

utxt.t: In a charmingly old-fashioned plot, they {wi}meet cute{/wi}, and she thinks it's true love …
… a picture-perfect love story about a man who uses paper planes to track down the woman he "{wi}met cute{/wi}" at the train station.
… leading two people on a chase through the streets of Paris until they {wi}meet-cute{/wi} in front of the Eiffel Tower.

shortdef: a cute, charming, or amusing first encounter between romantic partners (as in a movie)

dt.t: {ldquo}… I was so convinced at one point that I was about ready to be a goner, I mean to {wi}meet my maker{/wi}. … {rdquo}
My old car has finally gone to {wi}meet its maker{/wi}.
Prepare to {it}meet your doom{/it}.
Like his father, he {it}met his fate{/it} on the battlefield.

dt: {bc}to be opposed by someone as good as one is and who could defeat one

dt.t: She knew after the first game that she had {it}met her match{/it}.

shortdef: to be opposed by someone as good as one is and who could defeat one
